title: Will Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass publicly discuss a 'no-car' concept for the 2028 Olympics by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass makes a public statement or gives an interview specifically mentioning a concept of restricting or discouraging private car use for the 2028 Summer Olympics. The statement must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Los Angeles Times, or national broadcast networks). The concept doesn't need to be explicitly called 'no-car games', but should involve a significant emphasis on public transit or other alternatives to private vehicles for accessing Olympic venues. If no such statement is made or reported by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

article_information.article_description: The one question Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass is repeatedly asked about before her city hosts the 2028 Summer Olympics is traffic. Bass has declared it will be the “no-car games” and venues will only be accessible by public transportation. It will take more t…

title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants approval for MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the FDA or confirmed through reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers. The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If the FDA does not grant such approval by the specified date, or if they explicitly reject the approval, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary or conditional approvals do not count for a YES resolution.

article_information.article_description: Federal health officials have declined to approve the psychedelic drug MDMA as a therapy for PTSD. title: Will the FDA approve any psychedelic drug for PTSD therapy by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants approval for any psychedelic drug to be used in the treatment of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). The approval must be for the specific indication of PTSD therapy. Psychedelic drugs include, but are not limited to, MDMA, psilocybin, LSD, and ketamine. The approval must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider 'breakthrough therapy' designations or other preliminary steps; only full FDA approval for PTSD treatment will result in a YES resolution.

The approval must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as The New York Times or Bloomberg. The nasal spray must be specifically approved for treating severe allergic reactions, not just mild allergies. If no such approval is announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The recall should be for safety or efficacy reasons, not for manufacturing or packaging issues. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is not specific to any particular brand or product, but applies to any FDA-approved nasal spray for severe allergic reactions.

title: Will Stellantis announce the closure of its Warren Truck Plant by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Stellantis, the multinational automotive manufacturing corporation, officially announces the permanent closure of its Warren Truck Plant located near Detroit, Michigan, by August 31, 2024. The closure announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or Associated Press. Temporary shutdowns, partial closures, or production suspensions do not qualify as closure for this question. If no such announcement of permanent closure is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will more than 10 athletes test positive for COVID-19 during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
body: This question will resolve as YES if more than 10 athletes are confirmed to have tested positive for COVID-19 during the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. The confirmation must come from official Olympic records, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or at least three reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The positive tests must occur within the official Olympic period, including the opening and closing ceremonies. Athletes who test positive before arriving at the Olympic village or after departing from the Games will not be counted. If 10 or fewer athletes test positive during this period, or if there is insufficient verifiable information by August 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will any events at the 2024 Paris Olympics be canceled due to COVID-19?
body: This question will resolve as YES if any official Olympic events scheduled for the 2024 Paris Olympics are canceled specifically due to COVID-19 concerns. The cancellation must be officially announced by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), Paris 2024 Organizing Committee, or reported by at least three major reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or The New York Times). The cancellation must occur between the start of the Olympics and August 31, 2024. Postponements or rescheduling of events within the Olympic period do not count as cancellations. If no events are canceled due to COVID-19, or if events are canceled for reasons unrelated to COVID-19, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the Seine River's water quality meet acceptable bacteria levels for Olympic events in August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, during the Olympic events scheduled to take place in the Seine River in August 2024, the water quality data shows that bacteria levels are consistently within acceptable thresholds as defined by the Paris Olympics organizers and relevant health authorities. The question will resolve as NO if the bacteria levels exceed the acceptable thresholds at any point during the scheduled Olympic events in the Seine River in August 2024, leading to cancellations or alterations of water-based competitions. The resolution will be based on official reports from the Olympic organizing committee, relevant French health authorities, or credible news sources citing official data.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a federal rule allowing immigrants brought to the U.S. as children without legal status to enroll in health insurance plans under the Affordable Care Act (ACA) is officially implemented and goes into effect. The rule should specifically target this group of immigrants and be related to ACA health insurance enrollment. The implementation must be confirmed by official government sources or widely reported by major news outlets. If such a rule is not implemented by this date, or if it's blocked by legal challenges, the question resolves as NO.

The return must be confirmed by official NASA announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the astronauts are not returned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note: This question refers to the two astronauts who are on the ISS as of October 1, 2023, regardless of their names or when they were originally scheduled to return.

title: Will heart disease remain the leading cause of death in the US through August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, heart disease is reported as the leading cause of death in the United States according to official data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or another reputable national health organization. The data must be for the most recent period available, which should include at least part of 2024. If any other cause surpasses heart disease as the leading cause of death in this data, or if heart disease is no longer reported as the leading cause, the question resolves as NO. In case of a tie for the leading cause, with heart disease being one of the tied causes, the question will still resolve as YES.

title: Will the CDC report more than 3 deaths from the listeria outbreak linked to deli meats by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or other reputable health authorities (such as the FDA or WHO) officially report that more than three people have died as a direct result of the listeria outbreak linked to deli meats. The outbreak must be specifically associated with deli meats, though it does not need to be exclusively linked to a single brand. The death count must be clearly attributed to this specific outbreak. If the reported death toll remains at three or fewer by the resolution date, or if no update is provided by the CDC or other reputable health authorities by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. In case of conflicting reports, the CDC's official count will be considered authoritative.

The outbreak must be the same one referenced in the CDC's announcement from October 2023, which at that time had affected 43 people. If the number of people sickened remains at 50 or fewer, or if no update is provided by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. The resolution will be based on the most recent official data available by the end of August 2024.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Byju's, or any entity or individual directly affiliated with Byju's (such as company executives or their family members), has paid over $19 million to India's cricket governing board (BCCI - Board of Control for Cricket in India). Confirmation must come from official statements by Byju's, BCCI, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Economic Times, Financial Times). The payment must be directly related to Byju's obligations or agreements with BCCI. If no such payment is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the payment is confirmed to be less than $19 million, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Byju's insolvency case be resolved in favor of American lenders by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Byju's insolvency case is conclusively resolved in favor of the American lenders, as confirmed by official court rulings or statements from relevant judicial authorities. The resolution must clearly indicate that the American lenders' claims or requests have been upheld or granted in the insolvency proceedings. For the purpose of this question, 'American lenders' refers to the group represented by GLAS Trust Company, which is reportedly owed $1.2 billion. The question will resolve as NO if: 1) The case is not resolved by August 31, 2024, 2) The case is resolved in favor of Byju's or any party other than the American lenders, or 3) A partial or inconclusive resolution is reached that does not clearly favor the American lenders. The resolution of this question will be based on publicly available information from reputable news sources or official court documents.

title: Will Carles Puigdemont be arrested in Spain by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Carles Puigdemont, the former Catalonia leader who fled Spain after organizing an independence referendum in 2017, is confirmed to have been arrested by Spanish authorities by August 31, 2024. The arrest must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or El País). For the purpose of this question, 'arrest' means being taken into custody by Spanish law enforcement officials under a valid arrest warrant. If no such arrest occurs by the specified date, or if Puigdemont is detained but released without formal arrest, the question will resolve as NO.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, bet365 is confirmed to have refunded more than $500,000 to customers who won bets but were paid less than they were entitled to due to unilateral changes in odds during payouts. The refund amount must specifically relate to the issue of underpayment due to odds changes, not general refunds or promotional payouts. If no such refund meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question will resolve as YES if Disney's combined streaming business (including Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+) reports a profit in at least one quarterly earnings report released between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. The profit must be explicitly stated for the combined streaming segment in Disney's official financial reports or earnings calls. If the streaming business reports losses in all quarterly earnings reports released during this period, or if no clear profit is reported for the combined streaming segment, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'profit' refers to positive operating income or any equivalent measure used by Disney to report segment profitability.

title: Will Tesla announce any hardware recalls for cars in China by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla officially announces one or more hardware recalls for cars in China. The announcement must be confirmed by official Tesla statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). A hardware recall refers to a request for car owners to bring their vehicles to a service center for physical repairs or replacements, as opposed to software updates that can be done remotely. The recall must affect a significant number of vehicles (at least 100,000) to be considered for this question. If no such hardware recalls are announced by the specified date, or if only software-related recalls are announced, the question resolves as NO.
